section.title: Description
section.p: The introduction of a tube into a hollow organ (as the trachea or intestine) to keep it open or restore its patency if obstructed

stentry.p: Unique identifier for the type of larynoscope used.
laryngoscopeType : Code (1..1)
Contains a code Set that identifies the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.
route : Code (1..1)
Indicates the route of the endotracheal tube to the trachea. Suggested values include: Oral, Nasal, Tracheostomy, etc.
traumaObserved : Code (1..1)
An injury (as a wound) to living tissue caused by an extrinsic agent &lt;surgical trauma&gt;
tubeLength : Quantity (1..1)
Contains the length of the endotracheal tube at the external reference point.
tubeSize : Quantity (1..1)
Contains the size of the endotracheal tube.
biteBlock : SurgeryDevice (0..1)
Identifies the bite block is used to protect the endotracheal tube
endotrachealTube : SurgeryDevice (0..1)
Identifies the endotracheal tube used during the major portion of the procedure.
laryngoscope : SurgeryDevice (0..*)
Identifies the type of scope or laryngoscope blade used to facilitate endotracheal intubation.
stylet : SurgeryDevice (0..1)
Identifies the stylet that was used to shape the endotracheal tube during intubation.
